reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A beautiful story of second chances
reviews.reviewText: I personally believe everyone deserves a second chance, in their own way. This book was an amazing story of a second chance at starting over, finding love, and healing family relationships. It's beautiful, heartwarming, heartbreaking at moments, and filled with moments you'll want to enjoy every second of. This series has been amazing and this book was no exception. While at first when reading about this book, I wasn't sure how it could turn out well with a happy ending but I loved how author Rachael Bloome tied everything together and gave everyone the ending they deserve with smiles.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is the best series I've read. The characters are so well developed, and the way their stories weave together is perfect. Once I started reading the first book I had to continue to the end of the series. Thank you for a beautiful collection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars love this book line
reviews.reviewText: I've read all in this series, love them. I happen to like happy endings :)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Another great book by Rachael Bloom!! I loved the way she had each chapter for a character. The flow of this story was great. It moved right along, and I couldn't put it down. Highly recommend reading the entire series. It's one of the best.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wonderful characters in a lovely town.
reviews.reviewText: Just as enjoyable as all the others in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Sweet small town charm
reviews.reviewText: The Promise in the Poppies by Rachael Bloome 5 ⭐📖Cassie struggles with her fears of becoming a mother. Donna comes back to town to try and make amends.Welcome Home 🏡 All your favorite couples from this beloved series are back. I felt in the middle of the action from the introduction.With its rich history, festivals for all seasons and pleasant communities, Poppy Creek is a place I love to visit.This latest book has an added bonus of a mystery subplot.I cheered for Donna as she embraced sober living.You can begin again was a beautiful theme woven into the story.The Clause in Christmas, book one, is Cassie and Luke's love story. In some ways, this felt like a sequel of their story and I loved being back with my favorite couple.❤️Things I loved ❤️-a romance between leads over 50-second chances-redemption-peeking back into the lives of my favorite couples from prior books (what happens after the HEA)-Founder's Day Festival-All the baked goods & coffeeI enjoyed every minute of my time in Poppy Creek. If you've not read the series, books 1 & 2 are available free on YouTube as audiobooks.Books 1-7 are available on Scribd & Audible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Nice series. Clean romances. Enjoyable!
reviews.reviewText: ( Corrected review) : Nice series! By book 1 & 2, I was buying more of the series, and after book 3, I decided to get the paperbacks too. Clean romances, so very Enjoyable! I Will read these again, especially books 1-5,7. Books 6 & 8 seemed lacking somehow, even though the characters were Nice, … with plenty of sweetness in the stories albeit with sadness mixed in, but there was still something missing- although, In book 8, the hidden clues & poems and search for the diary were an unexpected high point; making It seem more like book 1 in that regard, and I was hoping for a prequel or a story spin off of that man’s friendship with Penny’s dad. He seemed as Likable as Frank!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A pretty dramatic conclusion
reviews.reviewText: I wasn't expecting to get most of this story from Cassie's troubled mother but I enjoyed her redemption arc, as well as her little love story. It was nice to watch her overcome being a drunk. I lived vicariously through her and Cassie because some of us never get that in real life. *le sigh*Watching all the previous characters go through mini trials and overcome personal obstacles was cathartic. A particular couple that is my favorite in this series really worried me for them. The way things worked out for them was a relief because I really wanted this man to have his chance at a do over since he missed his first one.I can't say I was shocked by the big reveal towards the end because I'm very perceptive on small details but I did like the way it panned out. I would've liked to see more of a comeuppance moment for this nasty character but Ms Bloome doesn't do vengeful for good reason. Too much love and forgiveness going around.It doesn't feel like the end of this series for me. I feel as if there could be some cross over moments in new endeavors down the road, so I'm not sad about the end. Especially because everyone had such a beautiful end to the story arc.
I loved reading this series about love.,second chances and God’s unfailing love and forgiveness, God will never leave us, He knows what we are going through

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The likeable characters make this series of stories enjoyable to read. The whole Poppy Creek series have that cosy Sunday evening in feeling.

reviews.reviewTitle: Loved the final of the series
reviews.reviewText: The Promise in Poppies by Rachael Bloome - Loved this last book in the Poppy Creek series! It was a perfect ending for a great series. All the characters come together, there was weddings, love, hate, secrets, triumphs, tears, twists and turns! It kept me interested and guessing throughout and most importantly every character had closure in this last book. I love a book that gives a happy ending for all the important characters!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Lots of happy endings and questions answered a secrets revealed all to the good a great series of books but maybe Rachel Bloome will revisit it sometime
